tests.name: chicago_difference
tests.snippet: In Chicago, how much snow falls each winter can vary dramatically. According to the National Weather Service, seasonal snowfall totals from 1900 to today have ranged from a low of **9.8 inches (1920‚Äì1921)** to a high of **89.7 inches
content: While Chicago‚Äôs known as the [Windy City], that lake breeze isn‚Äôt the only weather phenomenon that might take your breath away when you‚Äôre visiting our city. Does it snow in Chicago? Indeed, it does! Although the first measurable snowfall comes later than usual in some years, it definitely does snow in Chicago. If you‚Äôre visiting in the winter, take a moment to brush up on when it will snow in Chicago and how much snow will fall each month.
## When Will it Snow in Chicago?

If you live here, you already know that in Chicago, how much snow falls each month can vary widely from year to year! Sometimes the first snow arrives in October, while other years see hardly a flurry through December. So how do meteorologists answer the question of when does it snow in Chicago? Generally, they predict snowfall off and on from November through March, with April getting the occasional dusting. Whenever it does snow in Chicago, be sure to take advantage of the Chicago snow on the area‚Äôs many great sledding hills!

In Chicago, how much snow falls now compared to previous years? With records going back to 1900, the National Weather Service has tracked how much snow falls in Chicago. Seasonally in the years from 1900-present, the average inches of snow in Chicago have annually ranged from 9.8 inches in 1920 ‚Äì 1921 to 89.7 inches in 1978 ‚Äì 1979. That‚Äôs quite a range of inches of snow in Chicago! Winter 2020 ‚Äì 2021 got a total of 48.8, with the year prior getting quite a bit less, just 34.8 inches. Take a look at the annual inches of snow in Chicago over the last decade:
Here are the winter monthly snowfall ranges for winter 2020-2021:

Now that you know about the typical Chicago snow totals and when it will snow in Chicago, you can pack your parka and boots and prepare to witness the magic of Chicagoland in wintertime! Schedule a [visit to the Skydeck] this winter to see Chicago blanketed in snow from the [most unique vantage point] available. We‚Äôre here to help you plan your visit‚Äîcontact us for details about [dining on The Ledge], [Skydeck engagement parties], and other special event options!

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Similar sentence structure but key words substituted
tests.name: word_substitution_boundary
tests.content: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog in the sunny meadow today.
tests.snippet: The slow grey wolf leaps over the tired cat in the rainy forest today.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Same words but completely different order
tests.name: word_order_scrambled
tests.content: Machine learning models require large datasets for training and validation.
tests.snippet: Training and validation require large models for machine learning datasets.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Similar numbers in statistics context but different subject
tests.name: similar_statistics_different_values
tests.content: In 2024, the corporation disclosed earnings of $45.2 million with 12,500 staff across 28 regions.
tests.snippet: In 2019, the startup announced losses of $8.7 billion with 350 contractors across 3 cities.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Similar product names but different
tests.name: similar_product_names
tests.content: The new iPhone 15 Pro Max features an A17 Bionic chip with enhanced neural engine.
tests.snippet: The new Galaxy S24 Ultra features a Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chip with enhanced AI engine.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Overlapping topic but different phrasing
tests.name: overlapping_phrases_different_context
tests.content: Meteorologists predict heavy rain will drench northern areas beginning at dawn tomorrow.
tests.snippet: The traffic report indicates severe congestion on southern highways clearing by midnight tonight.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Similar location-based content
tests.name: similar_locations_different_details
content: Conditions: Partly cloudy with afternoon thunderstorms expected
snippet: Conditions: Mostly overcast with morning showers expected

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Similar topic with different wording and entities
tests.name: antonym_substitution
tests.content: Wall Street rallied sharply as traders demonstrated renewed optimism about semiconductor companies.
tests.snippet: Bond markets tumbled dramatically while analysts expressed growing pessimism regarding retail corporations.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Similar list items but different specifics
tests.name: similar_list_different_items

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Same template different entities
tests.name: same_template_different_entities
tests.content: John Smith, CEO of TechCorp Inc., announced the acquisition of DataFlow Systems for $2.3 billion.
tests.snippet: Jane Doe, CFO of InnovateCo Ltd., announced the merger with CloudSync Solutions for $1.8 billion.

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Sports score with similar format but different teams and scores
tests.name: similar_sports_scores

tests._comment: Token matcher boundary: Completely different recipe with similar structure
tests.name: similar_recipe_different_ingredients
tests.content: Combine 2 cups flour, 1 cup sugar, 3 eggs, and 1/2 cup butter in a bowl. Bake at 350¬∞F for 25 minutes.
tests.snippet: Blend 4 bananas, 2 avocados, 1 cup honey, and a splash of almond milk until smooth. Chill for 2 hours.
